title: CIS-Lab receives multi-year award for quantum-secure communications
description: The lab will lead a consortium developing verifiable post-quantum security for satellite networks.
content: The Cryptography and Information Security Laboratory (CIS-Lab) has been selected to coordinate a new international collaboration focused on quantum-secure communication infrastructures. The project combines advanced cryptographic protocol design with deployable satellite hardware demonstrations.

title: CIS-Lab hosts workshop on privacy-preserving machine learning
description: Researchers from academia and industry gathered to share cutting-edge insights on secure federated analytics.
content: Keynotes covered the latest directions in homomorphic encryption and secure aggregation at scale. Participants also joined hands-on sessions to explore open-source tooling maintained by CIS-Lab members.

title: Welcome our 2025 cohort of graduate researchers
description: We are excited to welcome seven new graduate students joining the lab this semester.
content: Incoming students will contribute to projects in differential privacy, secure multiparty computation, and hardware-level trusted execution. Welcome to the team!
